Unidentified men bombed a 138-kilovolt tower of National Grid Corporation of the Philippines (NGCP) in Manarapan village, Carmen Town, North Cotabato late October 3, causing power outages in parts of the province, Cotabato City and Maguindanao province. No one claimed responsibility for the attack but the province is being frequently harassed by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters.

Suspected New People's Army rebels staged an attack on a police car in the village of Caliling, Cauayan town, Negros Occidental province on October 3, injuring two Swedish citizens and their driver in a passing van in the crossfire. One guerrilla was also wounded in the gun battle. The rebels withdrew when army and police reinforcements arrived.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on October 12 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Soldiers cleared 12 buildings and killed two more militants on Thursday. According to government sources, as of Oct 12 the ongoing military operations left at least 1,021 people dead - 813 militants, 161 government security forces and 47 civilians. At least 100 Bukidnon farmers put up a protest camp outside the Department of Agrarian Reform central office in Quezon City, Manila on October 12, to highlight the issues of lack of social services, irrigation, and the distribution of more than 500 hectares of land covered by the Central Mindanao University. The farmers are members of the Bukidnon Free Farmers Association and Labourers Organization (BUFFALO), Tried Agricultural Movers Association of Rural Active Workers (Tamaraw), and the Landless Tillers Inhabitants of Musuan (Limus), collectively known as BTL.
Defusal: Government security forces defused a powerful improvised bomb Thursday afternoon (Oct 12) on the roadside at Barangay Lanate Bliss of Isabela City area, Basilan.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on October 13 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. (10 fatalities divided among the days from Oct 13 to Oct 15.)

Anti-coal activists held a rally at the offices of multinational bank JP Morgan Chase in Bonifacio Global City in Taguig on Oct 13 over the plan to build the Atimonan coal-fired power plant in Quezon province.
Government troops seize six firearms in Sitio Ventura in Barangay Wines, Baguio District, Davao City on Friday evening, October 13, assumed after encountering New People's Army rebels.

The Army's 39th Infantry Battalion encountered more than 30 members of the New People's Army at Barangay Batasan in Makilala, North Cotabato on Saturday (Oct 14). A wounded NPA rebel was captured during the gunfight. Two soldiers were wounded.

Armed men attacked a local trawler and abducted five crew members off Sulu while sailing near Pangutaran town area late on Saturday (Oct 14). No individual or group claimed responsibility for the attack, but Abu Sayyaf Group which is actively operating in Sulu and in nearby Tawi-Tawi province is suspected behind the attack.

Hundreds of rallyists, led by Tindig Pilipinas, staged a protest against President Duterte at the University of the Philippines (UP) in Diliman, Quezon City, Manila on Saturday (Oct 14). They The called for Duterte's signing of a waiver on the security of bank deposits and allow the opening of his and his family's accounts to put an end to claims of corruption.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on October 14 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Fighting intensified on Saturday as elite platoons of government troops stormed the perimeters of a 3-hectare area still being held militants. According to government sources, as of Oct 15 the ongoing military operations left at least 1,031 people dead - 822 militants, 162 government security forces and 47 civilians. (10 fatalities divided among the days from Oct 13 to Oct 15.)

Around 100 members of Navotas City's (Manila) fishing community, organized by the militant group Pamalakaya, held a protest at Navotas City's centennial plaza on Oct 17, against a 650-hectare reclamation project on Manila Bay, which they said would displace around 20,000 people.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified armed men at Barangay Alagao, San Ildefonso, Bulacan on Oct 18 or Oct 19.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Tondo, Manila on Oct 18.
A former policeman and a former fireman were shot dead by unidentified armed men at Barangay District 1, Cauayan, Isabela on Oct 18. The motive is still unclear.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on October 18 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of Oct 18 the ongoing military operations left at least 1,064 people dead - 854 militants, 163 government security forces and 47 civilians. (7 fatalities recorded for Oct 18.)

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: A member of the CAFGU Active Auxiliary (CAA) was shot dead by suspected New People's Army rebels while walking in Barangay Sangay, Palapag, Northern Samar on Oct 18.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified armed men at Barangay Poblacion Norte, Sta. Cruz, Ilocos Sur on Oct 18.

19 October. Suspected BIFF militants on a motorcycle threw a grenade at a roadside Army detachment at Barangay Labo-Labo, Shariff Aguak town area, Maguindanao late on Oct 19, injuring 5 soldiers belong to the Army's 57thInfantry Battalion.
Two farmers were allegedly shot dead with machine guns by members of the 86th Infantry Battalion in Isabela on Oct 19. The military reported the incident to be an encounter between them and the NPA.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on October 19 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. One soldier was killed and three others slightly injured (assumed on Oct 19). According to government sources, as of Oct 22 the ongoing military operations left at least 1,109 people dead - 897 militants, 165 government security forces and 47 civilians. (45 fatalities have been divided for the days from Oct 19 to Oct 22.)

Arrests: Two alleged top-ranking officials of the Communist Party of the Philippines - New People's Army (CPP-NPA) were arrested by the Criminal Investigation and Detection Group (CIDG) and the Philippine Army in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental on Oct 19.
Government troops shelled a BIFF lair at Barangay Pagatin 1, Sharif Saidona town, Maguindanao at past pm on Oct 19 with 105 Howitzer Cannon, killing two sons of BIFF Commander Kulaw Kasan.

The Philippine military continued its clearing operations against Maute and Abu Sayyaf militants in Marawi City on Oct 20, but started withdrawing troops from the city. According to government sources, as of Oct 22 the ongoing military operations left at least 1,109 people dead - 897 militants, 165 government security forces and 47 civilians. (45 fatalities have been divided for the days from Oct 19 to Oct 22.)

Farmers from Mindanao, Visayas, and Luzon camped outside the gate of the Department of Agrarian Reform in Quezon City on Oct 20, demanding distribution of land for free to landless farmers and farm workers and end the killing of peasants.

source: ABS CBN; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Tagum, Davao del Norte on 20 Oct 2017.

The Philippine military continued its clearing operations against Maute and Abu Sayyaf militants in Marawi City on Oct 21. According to government sources, as of Oct 22 the ongoing military operations left at least 1,109 people dead - 897 militants, 165 government security forces and 47 civilians. (45 fatalities have been divided for the days from Oct 19 to Oct 22.)

Property destruction: Suspected communist New People's Army torched and destroyed around PHP 10 million worth of construction equipment owned by a quarrying company at Bonbon village, Butuan City on Saturday (Oct 21). No injuries reported.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives; Bombo Radyo
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Lucena, Quezon on 21 Oct 2017.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Taguig, Metro Manila on 21 Oct 2017.
The Army's 26th Infantry Battalion encountered New People's Army rebels in a firefight on October 22 afternoon in Kilometer 8, Barangay Balit, San Luis, Agusan del Sur, killing two NPAs.

The Philippine military continued its clearing operations against about 30 Maute and Abu Sayyaf militants cornered in one building in Marawi City on Oct 22. According to government sources, as of Oct 22 the ongoing military operations left at least 1,109 people dead - 897 militants, 165 government security forces and 47 civilians. (45 fatalities have been divided for the days from Oct 19 to Oct 22.)

About 200 members of different militant groups from Negros Occidental held a demonstration hours before President Rodrigo Duterte was scheduled to arrive in Bacolod City on Oct 22, over failed campaign promises and called for justice for victims of extrajudicial killings. When demonstrators tried to break through police barricades, a scuffle ensured between demonstrators and police.

An off-duty soldier who returned home after fighting in Marawi was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding men at Purok Sweet Honey, Barangay Sta. Maria within Pagadian, Zamboanga del Sur after midnight on Oct 23. The motive is still unclear but the attackers are believed to be NPA rebels.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified armed men in the Port Area in Manila on Monday night (Oct 23).
Six drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Barangay 30, Caridad, Cavite City, Cavite on 23 Oct 2017.

The Philippine military continued its clearing operations against the last remnants of the Maute Group and Abu Sayyaf cornered in one building in Marawi City on Oct 23. The defence secretary declared Marawi City free from all militants and an end of combat operations on Monday, 5 month after the conflict erupted. According to government sources, as of Oct 23 the ongoing military operations left at least 1,132 people dead - 920 militants, 165 government security forces and 47 civilians. (23 fatalities recorded for Oct 23, but it is unclear when they occurred.)
The Army's 23rd Infantry Battalion encountered New People's Army rebels in a firefight at Purok 4, Barangay Nongnong, Butuan City on October 23. No casualties reported.

Farmers under the Tubajon Farmers Association (TUFA) held a protest in front of the Ayala Corporation's office in Cagayan De Oro City on Monday (Oct 23) for allegedly failing to compensate the farmers after they agreed to the conversion of the land they were occupying in Barangay Tubajon, Laguindingan town in Misamis Oriental.

Several small scale miners from Mt. Diwata in Compostela Valley Province protested in front of the Philippine Mining Development Corporation in Lanang, Davao City on Monday (Oct 23), against the plan of relocating ball mill operators outside Mt. Diwata.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified armed men in Tondo, Manila on Oct 24 morning.
A drug suspect was shot and killed by suspected vigilantes in Barangay Ibabang Iyam, Lucena town in Quezon on Oct 24.

700 farmers from various parts of the Central Luzon region marched to the Clark Freeport within Angeles City, Pampanga, which is hosting an Association of Southeast Asian Nations defence ministers assembly, on Tuesday (Oct 24), condemning the deaths of 91 farmers under the term of President Rodrigo Duterte. Policemen wielding shields and batons stopped members of the Alyansa ng mga Magbubukid sa Gitnang Luzon (AMGL) from reaching the Clark main gate at about 11 a.m.

Farmers from Mindanao, Visayas, and Luzon marched to and rallied at the gate of Camp Aguinaldo on Edsa in Quezon City, Manila on Oct 24, demanding distribution of land for free to landless farmers and farm workers and end the killing of peasants. Protesters burnt an effigy of Duterte.
A drug suspect and wife of a detained top drug dealer was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified armed man in in Barangay Ilayang Iyam within Lucena City, Quezon on Oct 24.
A radio journalist was shot dead by unidentified armed men in Bislig City in Surigao del Sur on Oct 24. Authorities say is a politically motivated killing.

Farmers, workers and members of progressive organizations held a protest rally in Cagayan De Oro province on Oct 25, demanding distribution of land for free to landless farmers and farm workers and end the killing of peasants.

assoc_actor_2: BAYAN: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan; Labour Group (Philippines)
source: Front Line Defenders; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Bulatlat; ProtectDefenders.eu; Manila Times
notes: A former Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (BAYAN), transport group leader, and paralegal, and his friend were shot dead by two unidentified assailants in Paradijon village, Gubat, Sorsogon province on 25 Oct 2017. The motive is still unclear but social activists claim that state security forces (assumed military) are behind the attack, which is in line with the state's attacks against human rights workers and other activists.

The environmental group Save Antique Movement held a protest action in Antique on Oct 25, against the DENR announcement that the ban on open-pit mining, which was imposed by former Environment Secretary Gina Lopez, will be lifted by DENR Secretary Roy Cimatu.

Farmers, workers and members of progressive organizations held a protest rally in Butuan on Oct 25, demanding distribution of land for free to landless farmers and farm workers and end the killing of peasants.

assoc_actor_1: PMCJ: Philippine Movement for Climate Justice
notes: The Philippine Movement for Climate Justice (PMCJ) took out a protest march from P. Del Rosario Extension to Colon Street in Cebu City, Cebu on Oct 25 and held a rally against the putting up of a coal-fired power plant close to a residential area in Barangay Sawang Calero in Cebu City.

Farmers, workers and members of progressive organizations held protest rallies in Cebu province on Oct 25, demanding distribution of land for free to landless farmers and farm workers and end the killing of peasants.

Farmers, workers and members of progressive organizations held a protest rally in Davao (assumed Davao City) on Oct 25, demanding distribution of land for free to landless farmers and farm workers and end the killing of peasants.

Farmers, workers and members of progressive organizations held protest rallies in Iloilo province on Oct 25, demanding distribution of land for free to landless farmers and farm workers and end the killing of peasants.

Farmers from Mindanao, Visayas, and Luzon marched to Mendiola near Malacanang in Manila on Oct 25, demanding distribution of land for free to landless farmers and farm workers and end the killing of peasants. Protesters were joined by workers and other supporters at the Welcome Rotonda and burnt an effigy of Duterte.

Farmers, workers and members of progressive organizations held a protest rally in Cebu City, Cebu on Oct 25, demanding distribution of land for free to landless farmers and farm workers and end the killing of peasants.

About 200 residents of Manicani Island in Guiuan town in Eastern Samar held a protest rally before the Eastern Visayas office of the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) in Tacloban City on Oct 25, against the application for renewal of the Heritage Mining Corp. (HMC) for another mining project on their island.

Two Visayan farmers in Barangay Gaunan, near the Liguasan Marsh in Mlang town in North Cotabato were killed by suspected members of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) on Thursday (Oct 26). Sources said the BIFF has been forcing Vesera and Patibu to pay 'protection money' or revolutionary tax on a regular basis.

Property Destruction: Unidentified persons torched three heavy equipment worth P4.4 million parked along the national highway in Barangay Tangnan area, Carigara town in Leyte province on Thursday morning (Oct 26) No injuries reported.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: New People's Army rebels shot dead an off-duty member of the Citizens' Armed Forces Geographical Unit in Arakan town, Cotabato on Oct 26.
Suspected New People's Army rebels shot dead a policeman on his way to report for duty in Tupi, South Cotabato on Oct 26.
A group of soldiers was filmed torturing a suspected Maute Group captive during the just-ended battle in southern Marawi City. The video aired on Oct 26.

Defusal: Philippines Government troops have recovered more than 2,000 pieces of unexploded bombs and improvised explosive devices (IEDs) in Marawi City while working to restore basic services in the city. The recovered bombs and IEDs were disposed of under military-supervised controlled detonation operations.

A farmer and member of local peasant organization Nigkasinabot Koy Mag-umma Tu Boston (NIGKUMB) was shot dead by suspected agents of the 67th IBPA on 28 Oct 2017, in Boston town area, Davao Oriental as reported by the human rights organization Karapatan.

Gunmen ambushed a truck and killed two high school students along a highway in Kiblawan town area, Davao del Sur province on Oct 29. Seven others, including the driver, were wounded in the attack. The ambush was believed to have been carried out by members of the B'laan tribe and could have been triggered by a clan war. Police are also looking into whether the ambush was carried out by rebels or members of the communist New People's Army.

Four soldiers were injured by exploding improvised explosive devices (IEDs) on Oct 29 or Oct 30 as the military continued to conduct mopping up and clearing operations in Marawi City. The booby traps were laid down by Maute gunmen at the height of the fighting.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; GMA News; Manila Bulletin
notes: Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Mangatarem, Pangasinan on 30 Oct 2017.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Manila Times
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified armed man in Barangay 28 in Caloocan City assumed around Oct 31.
Security forces killed a rebel fighter belonging to the Maute Group-Abu Sayyaf force that besieged Marawi City on Oct 31 during clearing operations in the city.
